en: Would you please stop talking?
zh: 能请你先别说话了吗？

en: Let's talk it out.
zh: 咱们好好谈谈吧。

en: Please raise your hand before you speak.
zh: 发言前请先举手。

en: Don't change the subject.
zh: 别转移话题。

en: We talked our time away.
zh: 咱们光顾着聊天，把时间都忘了。

en: Please don't cut me off like that.
zh: 请别那样打断我说话。

en: The story was so funny that I split my sides.
zh: 这故事太逗了，我都笑喷了。

en: We talked about various topics.
zh: 我们聊了各种各样的话题。

en: A tale never loses in the telling.
zh: 故事总是越传越邪乎。

en: The talk dragged on till three o'clock.
zh: 谈话一直拖到了三点钟。

en: Let's leave it at that.
zh: 就先聊到这儿吧。

en: The story begins far in the past.
zh: 故事要从很久以前说起。

en: The story begins a long time ago.
zh: 故事开始于很久很久以前。

en: To change the subject.
zh: 换个话题。

en: The focus of the talk is put on the content.
zh: 谈话的重点在于内容。

en: The belly is not filled with fair words.
zh: 漂亮话可填不饱肚子。

en: It is a long story.
zh: 说来话长。

en: Many things are easy to talk about, but difficult to actually carry out.
zh: 很多事情说起来容易，做起来难。

en: It isn't as if a child learning to talk studies.
zh: 小孩学说话并不像在刻意学习。

en: Talking is a human ability.
zh: 说话是人类的一种本能。

en: Don't whisper, let alone speak.
zh: 别说大声说话了，连咬耳朵都不行。

en: To speak is one thing and to write is another.
zh: 说是一回事，写是另一回事。

en: Speaking and writing are different.
zh: 说话和写作是两码事。

en: There are so many things to tell you that I don't know where to start.
zh: 我有太多话想跟你说了，都不知道从哪儿说起。

en: I have so many things to tell you that I don't know where to start.
zh: 我有好多事想告诉你，一时间不知道该怎么开头。

en: I can tell it's him by the way he speaks.
zh: 我一听他说话就知道是他。

en: You're speaking a little too fast for me. Would you speak a little more slowly?
zh: 你说得有点太快了，能不能说慢点儿？

en: Just looking for someone to talk to.
zh: 只是想找个人聊聊天。

en: I just want someone to talk to.
zh: 我只想找个人说话。

en: I need someone to talk with.
zh: 我需要找个人谈谈。

en: This room is noisy. The sound bounces right off the walls.
zh: 这屋里太吵了，回音特别大。

en: Some are called good talkers, and others good listeners.
zh: 有人擅长说，有人擅长听。

en: The speaker illustrated the theory with examples.
zh: 演讲者举例说明了那个理论。

en: The speaker brought the truth home to us.
zh: 演讲者让我们深刻理解了真相。

en: The speaker couldn't make himself heard.
zh: 演讲者的声音根本听不见。

en: A crowd of people gathered around the speaker.
zh: 一群人围在演讲者身边。

en: We have a lot of ground to cover.
zh: 我们还有很多内容要讨论。

en: Will you make a list of issues to discuss?
zh: 能列个要讨论的问题清单吗？

en: There was a brief break in the discussion.
zh: 讨论中途短暂休息了一会儿。

en: I have tried to compile the ideas that you proposed prior to the meeting, so that we can use them as the base for the discussion.
zh: 我把你们会前提出的一些想法整理了一下，方便咱们讨论。

en: They never talk but they quarrel.
zh: 他们一开口准得吵架。

en: Every time they talk, they argue.
zh: 他们每次聊天都会争执。

en: Some seldom speak unless spoken to.
zh: 有些人除非别人先开口，否则很少说话。

en: Some people seldom speak unless they're spoken to.
zh: 有些人就是别人不找他说话，他就不怎么开口。

en: There are people who seldom speak unless they're spoken to.
zh: 有的人就是这样，没人找他说话，他就不吭声。

en: Don't be afraid to show yourself through speech and take every opportunity to speak to others in English and soon you will feel right at home in informal conversational situations.
zh: 别怕表现自己，抓住每个机会用英语跟人交流，你很快就会适应这种非正式场合的。

en: I know from his speech that he is not an American.
zh: 听口音我就知道他不是美国人。

en: Take down the main points of the speech.
zh: 记下演讲的要点。

en: May I speak to you?
zh: 我能跟你谈谈吗？

en: As he talked, he got more and more excited.
zh: 他越说越激动。

en: Don't talk!
zh: 别说话！

en: I want to talk to you about something.
zh: 我想跟你谈点事儿。

en: Answer at once when spoken to.
zh: 问你话呢，赶紧回答。

en: It is too good to be true.
zh: 这好得有点不真实。

en: The speech was so boring that they went away one by one.
zh: 演讲太无聊了，大家一个接一个都溜了。

en: His speech had more and more power as it went along.
zh: 他的演讲越讲越有感染力。

en: The story was too pat and I got rather suspicious.
zh: 这故事听着太凑巧了，我有点怀疑。

en: That's not what you said before.
zh: 你之前可不是这么说的。

en: The story wandered.
zh: 故事讲得东拉西扯的。

en: There was a momentary pause in the talk.
zh: 谈话中间停顿了一下。

en: That's too good to be true.
zh: 这好得简直不敢相信。

en: Can we talk in private?
zh: 我们能单独聊聊吗？

en: If you want to speak to me, please call me up.
zh: 想找我就给我打电话。

en: It is rumored that secret peace talks have already begun.
zh: 听说秘密和谈已经开始了。

en: The peace talks failed again, with both sides blaming the other for the failure.
zh: 和谈又谈崩了，两边都赖对方。

en: The peace talks failed again.
zh: 和谈又失败了。

en: Peace talks will begin next week.
zh: 和谈下周开始。

en: The peace talks have been suspended for a while.
zh: 和谈暂停了一段时间。

en: Men in kimonos are no longer a common sight in Tokyo.
zh: 在东京，穿和服的男的已经不多见了。

en: Have you ever eaten Japanese food?
zh: 你吃过日料吗？

en: Do you like Japanese food?
zh: 你喜欢吃日料吗？

en: It is said that some British people like a Japanese-style room.
zh: 听说有些英国人挺喜欢日式房间的。

en: It's said that some Englishmen like Japanese-style rooms.
zh: 听说有些英国人喜欢住日式房间。

en: Kazuko really takes after her sister.
zh: 和子长得跟她姐姐真像。

en: They live together in unity.
zh: 他们和睦地住在一起。

en: They are living harmoniously.
zh: 他们生活得很和谐。

en: It was Socrates who laid the foundation of logic.
zh: 是苏格拉底奠定了逻辑学的基础。

en: Have you finished writing your thesis?
zh: 论文写完了吗？

en: You have to take your time over your thesis.
zh: 论文得慢慢磨，不能急。

en: The thesis is finished except for the conclusion.
zh: 论文就差个结论就写完了。

en: Although the paper was much longer than last year's a few students managed to finish.
zh: 虽然卷子比去年的长了不少，但还是有几个学生做完了。

en: Why don't you take your time in finishing your paper?
zh: 论文慢慢写嘛，别急。

en: Don't pussyfoot around the issue; do we have a problem, or don't we?
zh: 别绕弯子了，到底有没有问题？

en: I see the point of the argument.
zh: 我明白争论的焦点在哪儿。

en: Central to this issue is the problem of modernization.
zh: 问题的核心是现代化。

en: Hotly debated topics: proactive stance against discrimination and school busing.
zh: 热门辩题：反歧视立场和校车接送问题。

en: The dispute was finally settled.
zh: 争端终于解决了。

en: Let's end this debate.
zh: 咱们别争了。

en: Example is better than precept.
zh: 身教胜于言教。

en: Needless to say, fundamental human rights should be respected.
zh: 毫无疑问，基本人权应当受到尊重。

en: Please play it back for me after you've finished the recording.
zh: 录完之后请放给我听听。

en: I have a reservation for six-thirty.
zh: 我预订了六点半的。

en: We have a reservation for six-thirty.
zh: 我们预订了六点半的。

en: Please wake me up at 6:30.
zh: 请在六点半叫醒我。

en: I took my temperature every six hours.
zh: 我每隔六小时量一次体温。

en: Come here at six, not before.
zh: 六点再来，别早到。

en: Come here at exactly six o'clock.
zh: 六点整准时过来。

en: Come here at precisely six o'clock.
zh: 刚好六点到这儿。

en: June is a social season in London.
zh: 六月是伦敦的社交季。

en: In June, it rains day after day.
zh: 六月的时候，天天都在下雨。

en: We have a lot of rain in June.
zh: 我们这儿六月雨水很多。

en: There's a lot of rain in June.
zh: 六月份经常下雨。

en: Deaf-mute people talk using sign language.
zh: 聋哑人靠手语交流。

en: An aging population will require more spending on health care.
zh: 人口老龄化意味着在医疗保健方面的支出会增加。

en: Old age creeps upon us unnoticed.
zh: 人总是在不知不觉中变老的。

en: His old age is beginning to affect his eyesight.
zh: 他年纪大了，视力开始变差了。

en: He is worn with age.
zh: 他看起来很苍老。

en: The old woman got hurt when she fell.
zh: 那个老奶奶摔跤受伤了。

en: The old woman was ill in bed.
zh: 那位老奶奶病倒在床。

en: The old woman sent a servant for the trunk.
zh: 老太太派佣人去取那个箱子。

en: The old woman extended a loving hand to the children.
zh: 老奶奶慈爱地向孩子们伸出了手。

en: The old lady made her a present of it and insisted she should have it.
zh: 老太太把它作为礼物送给了她，还坚持要她收下。

en: The old woman gave it to her as a present and said she really wanted her to accept it.
zh: 老奶奶把它当作礼物送给她，说真心希望她能收下。

en: The old lady lived in a three-room apartment by herself.
zh: 老奶奶独自住在一个三居室的公寓里。

en: The old woman lived in a 3 room apartment by herself.
zh: 老太太一个人住在一个三居室里。

en: The old lady thanked me for helping her across the road.
zh: 老奶奶感谢我扶她过马路。

en: An old woman is walking across the road.
zh: 一位老奶奶正走过马路。

en: The old woman is crossing the road.
zh: 那个老奶奶在过马路。

en: I helped an old lady across.

en: The old woman smiled with a sigh of relief.

en: An old woman was burnt to death.
zh: 一位老太太被烧死了。

en: Old age is an island surrounded by death.
zh: 老年就像是一座被死亡包围的孤岛。

en: It's a shame the way old people are treated.
zh: 这样对待老人实在是太不像话了。

en: The old are not always wiser than the young.
zh: 老人并不总比年轻人更聪明。

en: Old people aren't always wiser than young people.
zh: 老年人不见得总比年轻人更有智慧。

en: You have to respect the old.
zh: 你应该尊重长辈。

en: You need to respect the elderly.
zh: 你需要尊敬老人。

en: You must respect senior citizens.
zh: 你必须尊重老年人。

en: Old people deserve respect.
zh: 老人应该得到尊重。

en: It is wrong to make fun of an old man.
zh: 取笑老人家是不对的。

en: The old man was sitting with his arms folded.
zh: 那位老人两手交叉抱在胸前坐着。

en: The old man gave me a useful piece of advice.
zh: 老人家给了我一个非常有用的建议。

en: The old man sat on the bench with his eyes closed.
zh: 老爷爷闭着眼睛坐在长凳上。

en: An old man lay dead on the road.
zh: 一个老头死在了路边。

en: The old man breathed his last.
zh: 老人咽下了最后一口气。

en: The old person breathed his last breath.
zh: 老人断了气。

en: The old man wondered why life had passed him by.
zh: 老人家想不通这一辈子怎么就这么过去了。

en: The old man walked with a stick.
zh: 那位老爷爷拄着拐杖走路。

en: The old man saw my notebook and smiled at me.
zh: 老爷爷看到我的笔记本，对我笑了笑。

en: The old man asked me a favor.
zh: 老人家请我帮个忙。

en: The old person asked me a favor.
zh: 那位老人请我帮个忙。

en: The old man told the children an amusing story.
zh: 老爷爷给孩子们讲了一个很有趣的故事。

en: The old man sat surrounded by the children.
zh: 老爷爷被一群孩子围在中间。

en: The old man passed away this morning.
zh: 那位老人今天早上去世了。

en: The old man stopped for a moment to rest.
zh: 老爷爷停下来歇了一会儿。

en: The old man told us about the amusing incident.
zh: 老爷爷跟我们讲了那件有趣的事。

en: Old people look back on the past too much.
zh: 老人总是太爱回忆过去了。

en: Old people are inclined to look back on the past.
zh: 老年人往往倾向于回忆往事。

en: The old man loaded his mule with bags full of sand.
zh: 老头往骡子背上装了几袋子沙。

en: The old man beguiled the weary day with cards.
zh: 老人家靠打牌来消磨这难熬的一天。

en: The old man sat all alone.
zh: 那个老头儿孤零零地坐着。

en: The old man looked surprised at the news.
zh: 听到那个消息，那个老头儿显得挺吃惊的。

en: The old man gave the child shelter.

en: The old man lived there by himself.

en: The old person was living there by himself/herself.
zh: 那位老人独自住在那儿。

en: The old man often looks back on his youth.
zh: 那个老头儿经常回想起年轻的时候。

en: The old man assumed an impudent attitude.
zh: 那个老头儿态度挺傲慢的。

en: The old are apt to catch cold.
zh: 老年人容易感冒。

en: Old people catch colds easily.
zh: 老人特别容易感冒。

en: The old man tried to hide his money under the ground.
zh: 那个老头儿想把钱埋在地下。

en: The old man looked about for his hat.
zh: 那个老头儿四下寻找他的帽子。

en: The old man's narrative was punctuated by coughs.
zh: 那个老头儿边说边咳嗽，话都断断续续的。

en: The old man's anger melted.
zh: 那个老头儿消气了。

en: We must think about the care of old people.
zh: 咱们得考虑下老人的养老问题。

en: Don't make fun of old people.
zh: 别拿老人开玩笑。

en: A portrait of an old man was hanging on the wall.
zh: 墙上挂着一张老人的画像。

en: There's no fool like an old fool.
zh: 越老越糊涂。

en: There is no fool like an old fool.
zh: 老糊涂才是真的糊涂。

en: There should be more national hospitals for old people.
zh: 应该多建一些公立的老年医院。

en: It was civil of him to offer his seat to the old man.
zh: 他给老人让座，挺有礼貌的。

en: You can't teach an old dog new tricks.
zh: 老狗学不会新把戏。

en: When I was asked by an old man where the church was, I pointed it out.
zh: 有个老人问我教堂在哪儿，我指给他看了。

en: Old people need someone to talk to.
zh: 老年人需要有人陪他们说说话。

en: Old people need something to live for.
zh: 老人也得有个精神寄托。

en: We must be as kind to old people as possible.
zh: 咱们得尽量对老人好一点。

en: It's hard for an old man to change his way of living.
zh: 老人很难改变生活习惯。

en: The Old Man and the Sea is a very exciting book.
zh: 《老人与海》是一本特别精彩的书。

en: The old people were taken good care of.
zh: 老人们得到了很好的照顾。

en: The old people got sufficient care.
zh: 老人们得到了足够的照料。

en: The old people received enough care.
zh: 老人们得到了充足的关怀。

en: Although old, he is still very much alive.
zh: 他虽然老了，但还很有活力。

en: He may be old, but he is still very healthy.
zh: 他虽然年纪大了，但身体还挺硬朗的。

en: An old man spoke to me suddenly.
zh: 有个老头儿突然跟我说话。

en: The old person suddenly started talking to me.
zh: 那位老人突然跟我搭起话来。

en: An old man sat surrounded by his grandchildren.
zh: 一个老头儿坐在孙子孙女中间。

en: It is important for old people to stay strong.
zh: 对老人来说，保持身体强健很重要。

en: The old man was run over by a car.
zh: 那个老头儿被车撞了。

en: It is hard for an old man to change his way of thinking.
zh: 老人很难改变思维方式。

en: The old man was plodding along.
zh: 那个老头儿正慢悠悠地往前走。

en: An old man came tottering along.
zh: 有个老头儿摇摇晃晃地走过来。

en: The old woman studied the visitor carefully.
zh: 那个老太太仔细打量着来访的人。

en: I want to live comfortably when I become old.
zh: 我老了以后想过得舒服点。

en: If you want security in your old age, begin saving now.
zh: 要是想老了有保障，现在就开始存钱吧。

en: I'm saving money for my old age.
zh: 我在存养老钱。

en: I will save up money for when I'm old.
zh: 我要攒钱等老了花。

en: Conscientiously save money for one's old age.
zh: 踏踏实实地攒养老钱。

en: Everybody thinks that they are ready for their old age.
zh: 大家都觉得自己已经为晚年做好了准备。

en: This is a condition caused by aging.
zh: 这是衰老引起的现象。

en: I'm getting farsighted as I get older.
zh: 随着年纪变大，我开始老花了。

en: Young and old went to battle.
zh: 老老少少都上战场了。

en: You have to get more exercise in order to stave off senility.
zh: 为了预防老年痴呆，你得多多运动。

en: Both young and old, men and women, regularly get together at the local bathhouses.
zh: 男女老少经常聚在当地的公共浴室里。

en: As they grow old, many people become unable to look after themselves.
zh: 随着年纪变大，很多人都没法自理了。

en: You must think of your old parents at home.
zh: 你得想想家里年迈的父母啊。

en: To my dismay I found I had lost my money.
zh: 真倒霉，我发现我的钱丢了。

en: Talk of the wolf and behold his skin.
zh: 说曹操，曹操到。

en: Can you tell wolves from dogs?
zh: 你分得清狼和狗吗？

en: Flatterers look like friends, as wolves like dogs.
zh: 马屁精看起来像朋友，就像狼看起来像狗一样。

en: The leak needs to be stopped immediately.
zh: 漏水的地方得赶紧堵住。

en: Waste makes want.
zh: 浪费必致匮乏。

en: It is not wise, nor in the long run is it kind, to tax the thrifty for the thriftless.
zh: 拿节俭的人的税去贴补挥霍的人，既不明智，长远来看也不厚道。

en: The corridor was so crowded that we couldn't walk.
zh: 走廊里挤得我们根本走不动。

en: Watch your step, as the passageway is slippery.
zh: 走廊太滑了，走路当心点。

en: The hallway is slippery, so watch your step.
zh: 走廊很滑，小心脚下。

en: There's a fire down the hall.
zh: 走廊尽头着火了。

en: The emerging labor shortage is viewed as a sign of economic overheating.
zh: 劳动力短缺的出现被看作是经济过热的信号。

en: The disagreement between the union and management could lead to a strike.
zh: 工会和管理层之间的分歧可能会导致罢工。

en: The number of days lost through industrial dispute is shown in the table on the facing page.
zh: 劳资纠纷造成的损失天数列在对面那页的表里。

en: The labor union is negotiating with the owners.
zh: 工会正在和老板们谈判。

en: The labor union called a strike.
zh: 工会发起了罢工。

en: The labor union announced a strike.
zh: 工会宣布要罢工。

en: The workers union called off their 24-hour strike today.
zh: 工会今天取消了那场24小时的罢工。

en: The union bosses are fighting the freeze on wage hikes.
zh: 工会大佬们正在抵制工资冻结。

en: They want to better their working conditions.
zh: 他们想改善工作条件。

en: The workers asked for an increase in pay.

en: Some people traveled by train, and others by road.

en: You must decide whether you will go by train or by plane.
zh: 你得决定是坐火车还是坐飞机。

en: It is advisable to go by train.
zh: 最好坐火车去。

en: I went as far as Kyoto by train.
zh: 我坐火车一直坐到了京都。

en: It's only four minutes from here by train.
zh: 从这儿坐火车只要四分钟。

en: Because the train did not wait for me.
zh: 因为火车没等我。

en: We arrived at the station as the train was leaving.
zh: 我们到车站的时候，火车正好开了。

en: As the train came to a halt, all of the passengers wondered what was happening.
zh: 火车停下来的时候，乘客们都在想出什么事了。

en: The train is in.
zh: 火车进站了。

en: The train has arrived.
zh: 火车到了。

en: They had to change their schedule because the train arrived late.
zh: 因为火车晚点，他们不得不改了行程。

en: Even though the train was late, we made it in time.
zh: 虽然火车晚了，但我们还是赶上了。

en: The train was derailed and about thirty passengers were either killed or injured.
zh: 火车脱轨了，大概有三十名乘客伤亡。

en: The train was derailed, and panic ensued.
zh: 火车脱轨了，大家顿时乱成一团。

en: I only got to the station after the train had left.
zh: 我到车站的时候，火车已经开了。

en: The train disappeared from view.
zh: 火车从视线里消失了。

en: The train passed by us.
zh: 火车从我们身边经过。

en: Don't open the door till the train stops.
zh: 火车停稳之前别开门。

en: You must not get off the train before it stops.
zh: 火车还没停稳，千万别下车。

en: It was because of the storm that the trains were halted.
zh: 因为暴风雨，火车停运了。

en: The train was so crowded that we were obliged to stand all the way to Osaka.
zh: 火车上人特别多，我们只能一直站到大阪。

en: Look at the train going over the bridge.
zh: 看，那列火车正从桥上过呢。

en: It began to snow heavily as I got off the train.
zh: 我下火车的时候，雪下得特别大。

en: There being no train, we had to walk all the way.
zh: 没火车了，我们只好一路走过去。

en: The train roared through the tunnel.
zh: 火车轰隆隆地穿过了隧道。

en: The train leaves in ten minutes.
zh: 火车还有十分钟就开了。

en: As they walk up and down the rows they shout, "Get your hot dogs here! Get your hot dogs!"
zh: 他们在过道里走来走去，喊着：“买热狗嘞！热狗！”

en: After a long wait in line, she was told she should get a certified copy of her birth certificate as identification.
zh: 排了好久的队，才被告知要拿出生证明的认证副本做身份证件。

en: Line up and walk to the door in order.
zh: 排好队，按顺序走到门口。

en: The historical thesis can be summarized by saying that Darwinism has undergone three stages of evolution.
zh: 那个历史论题可以总结为：达尔文主义经历了三个进化阶段。

en: We visited places of historic interest.
zh: 我们参观了名胜古迹。

en: History is a branch of the humanities.
zh: 历史是人文学科的一个分支。

en: History repeats itself.
zh: 历史总是在重演。

en: The role of the historian is less to discover and catalog documents than to interpret and explain them.
zh: 历史学家的职责与其说是发现和整理文献，不如说是去解读和阐释它们。

en: History deals with the past.
zh: 历史研究的是过去的事。

en: History has never fared well against legend.
zh: 历史总是敌不过传说。

en: History presents us with many different answers to each question.
zh: 历史对同一个问题往往有很多种答案。

en: History goes on with old ideas giving way to the new.
zh: 历史滚滚向前，新旧观念不断交替。

en: Professor Suzuki is an expert historian.
zh: 铃木教授是个历史专家。

en: The history class starts at nine.
zh: 历史课九点开始。

en: During the history test, she felt very sick, so she got a pass to go to the toilet.
zh: 考历史的时候，她觉得特别难受，就请假去了趟厕所。

en: To me, fair friend, you never can be old.
zh: 对我来说，亲爱的朋友，你永远不会老。

en: The primates include not only the apes, but also man.
zh: 灵长类动物不仅包括猿类，也包括人类。

en: Grooming in primates increases group cohesion.
zh: 灵长类动物互相梳理毛发能增强族群的凝聚力。

en: Mom-and-pop stores will turn a profit in the new fiscal year.
zh: 那些夫妻店在新的财年会有盈利的。

en: Small enterprises are feeling the squeeze of inflation.

en: Mom-and-pop bakeries were overwhelmed by supermarkets.
zh: 那些夫妻面包店都被超市给挤垮了。

en: Mr Suzuki teaches us English.
zh: 铃木老师教我们英语。

en: When did Mr Suzuki leave Japan?
zh: 铃木先生什么时候离开日本的？

en: When did Mr. Suzuki leave Japan?
zh: 铃木先生什么时候离开日本的？

en: Mr Suzuki is a great scientist.
zh: 铃木先生是一位伟大的科学家。

en: Mr. Suzuki is a great scientist.
zh: 铃木先生是一位伟大的科学家。

en: Mr Suzuki persuaded his son to drop his plan to study abroad.
zh: 铃木先生说服他儿子放弃了出国留学的计划。

en: Mr. Suzuki persuaded his son to drop his plan to study abroad.
zh: 铃木先生劝他儿子打消了出国留学的念头。

en: Mr. Suzuki persuaded his son to give up his plan to study abroad.
zh: 铃木先生说服他儿子放弃了留学计划。

en: Mr Suzuki may well be proud of his son.
zh: 铃木先生完全有理由为他儿子感到自豪。

en: This is Mr Suzuki speaking.
zh: 我是铃木。

en: Please get Miss Suzuki on the phone.
zh: 请帮我接一下铃木小姐。

en: Mr Suzuki is not a dentist but a physician.
zh: 铃木先生不是牙医，而是个内科医生。

en: Mr. Suzuki isn't a dentist. He's a physician.
zh: 铃木先生不是牙医，他是个内科医生。

en: Mrs. Suzuki is a very economical housekeeper.
zh: 铃木太太是个非常精打细算的管家。

en: Mrs Suzuki was giving a speech that afternoon.
zh: 铃木太太那天下午在做演说。

en: Mr. Suzuki was giving a speech that afternoon.
zh: 铃木先生那天下午在做演讲。

en: Mr Suzuki, as far as I know, has not returned from Hawaii yet.
zh: 据我所知，铃木先生还没从夏威夷回来。

en: Mr Suzuki has three daughters.
zh: 铃木先生有三个女儿。

en: That's the spirit, Mr Suzuki.
zh: 就是这股劲儿，铃木先生。

en: That's the spirit, Mr. Suzuki.
zh: 就是这种精神，铃木先生。

en: It was courteous of him to write a letter of thanks.
zh: 他特意写了封感谢信，真有礼貌。

en: It pays to be polite.

en: Mind your manners.

en: Courtesy marked his manner.

en: Polite Americans are polite at all times.

en: You must look to your manners.
zh: 你得注意点儿礼貌。

en: Politeness is less observed today than it used to be.
zh: 现在的礼数没以前那么周全了。

en: How do I fix the air-conditioner?
zh: 空调怎么修啊？

en: Many housewives make good use of frozen food.
zh: 很多家庭主妇都很会利用冷冻食品。

en: Refer to the instructions to fix the refrigerator.

en: Refer to the instruction manual if you need to fix the refrigerator.
zh: 如果要修冰箱，可以参考一下说明书。

en: Opening the refrigerator, I noticed the meat had spoiled.
zh: 打开冰箱的时候，我发现肉已经坏了。

en: When I opened the refrigerator, I noticed the meat had spoiled.
zh: 我一开冰箱，就发现肉变质了。

en: The refrigerator preserves food from decay.
zh: 冰箱能防止食物腐坏。

en: The refrigerator prevents food from going bad.
zh: 冰箱能让食物不容易变质。

en: Refrigerators help to preserve food.

zh: 冰箱里的东西随便吃，别客气。

en: Nothing remained in the refrigerator.
zh: 冰箱里什么都没剩。

en: There was nothing left in the refrigerator.
zh: 冰箱里已经空空如也了。

en: There are two pounds of butter in the icebox.
zh: 冰箱里有两磅黄油。

en: Put the tomato salad in the refrigerator.
zh: 把番茄沙拉放进冰箱里。

en: Is there much food in the refrigerator?
zh: 冰箱里的吃的还多吗？

en: When I opened the door of the refrigerator, an apple fell out.
zh: 我一开冰箱门，一个苹果就掉出来了。

en: A refrigerator keeps meat fresh.
zh: 冰箱能保持肉类新鲜。

en: It's been about two days since I put the body in the refrigerator.
zh: 我把尸体放进冰箱已经差不多两天了。

en: Is there anything to drink in the refrigerator?
zh: 冰箱里有喝的吗？

en: There is no meat left in the fridge.
zh: 冰箱里没肉了。

en: There is little food in the refrigerator.
zh: 冰箱里基本没什么吃的了。

en: There isn't much butter left in the refrigerator.
zh: 冰箱里的黄油剩得不多了。

en: Is there any butter in the refrigerator?
zh: 冰箱里有黄油吗？

en: The Cold War ended when the Soviet Union collapsed.
zh: 苏联解体时，冷战也随之结束了。

en: The cold war ended along with the fall of the USSR.
zh: 冷战随着苏联的倒台而结束了。

en: Cold-war tension has mounted.
zh: 冷战局势变得更加紧张了。

en: Get real!

en: Cool down and think it over again.
zh: 冷静点，再好好想想。

en: I tried to be calm, but finally I lost my temper.
zh: 我努力想冷静，但最后还是发火了。

en: The situation calls for our cool judgement.
zh: 这种情况需要我们冷静判断。

en: A cold bath refreshed him.
zh: 洗个冷水澡让他精神多了。

en: The water cooler is out of order.
zh: 饮水机坏了。

en: Thanks to a cold summer, beer has sold poorly.
zh: 因为夏天太凉快，啤酒卖得不太好。

en: I'd like a chilled one.
zh: 我想要个冰的。

en: The cold north wind turned the leaves brown.
zh: 寒冷的北风把叶子吹枯了。

en: The cold wind is blowing from the sea.
zh: 海上吹来了阵阵寒风。

en: The cold wind chilled the traveler.
zh: 寒风把那个赶路的人冻坏了。

en: The cold wind cut through his coat.
zh: 寒风刺透了他的外套。

en: Cold winds blow hard every winter.
zh: 每年冬天寒风都刮得很厉害。

en: A cold wind blew in.
zh: 一股冷风吹了进来。

en: A cold wind was blowing.
zh: 正刮着冷风呢。

en: The cold weather slowed the growth of the rice plants.
zh: 天气太冷，水稻长得慢了。

en: Bring me some cold water.
zh: 给我拿点凉水来。

en: You shouldn't eat anything cold.
zh: 你不该吃凉的东西。

en: I'm dying for a cold drink.
zh: 我真想喝杯凉的。

en: I am dying for a cold drink.
zh: 我真想喝杯冰的。

en: I would love a cold glass of beer.
zh: 我真想喝杯冰啤酒。

en: My teeth are sensitive to cold foods.
zh: 我的牙怕凉。

en: That's a bit cold.
zh: 那样有点儿太冷淡了。

en: Let's talk over a cold beer.
zh: 咱们喝杯冰啤酒，边喝边聊。

en: A cold beer would hit the spot!
zh: 来杯冰啤酒就太爽了！

en: I hear that you are having an unusually cold winter.
zh: 听说你们那儿今年冬天冷得出奇。

en: The company, although with some exceptions, usually utilizes its resources very well.
zh: 这家公司虽然偶尔有例外，但通常资源利用得很好。

en: The exception was in China, where flat bread was probably not eaten.
zh: 中国是个例外，那儿可能不吃这种大饼。

en: I insist that exceptions not be made.
zh: 我坚持不能破例。

en: I don't think an exception should be made.
zh: 我觉得不应该破例。

en: The exception proves the rule.
zh: 例外反而证明了规律。

en: There is no rule without exceptions.
zh: 凡事都有例外。

en: Every law has its exception.
zh: 任何法律都有例外。

en: There is no rule but has some exceptions.
zh: 任何规则都有例外。

en: There is no rule without an exception.
zh: 规律总有例外。

en: There are no rules without exceptions.
zh: 没有不带例外的规则。

en: Every rule has its exceptions.
zh: 规则总会有例外。

en: Quote me an example.
zh: 给我举个例子。

en: Show me an example.
zh: 给我看个例子。

en: The examples are as follows.
zh: 示例如下。

en: How is that business progressing?
zh: 那个业务进展得怎么样了？

en: How's that business going?
zh: 那桩生意做得怎么样了？

en: I don't think we can keep the lid on the scandal much longer; people are bound to find out.
zh: 我觉得这桩丑闻瞒不了多久了，大家迟早会知道的。

en: That customer came back to complain again.
zh: 那个客人又回来投诉了。

en: As is his way, he eats reading a newspaper.
zh: 他还是老样子，边吃饭边看报纸。

en: As is often the case, he eats while reading a newspaper.
zh: 像往常一样，他一边吃饭一边看报纸。

en: As is often the case with her, she didn't show up on time.
zh: 她这人经常这样，又没按时到。

en: As is often the case with him, he didn't show up on time.
zh: 他这人经常这样，又没准时到。

en: The phone rang while I was taking a bath, as usual.
zh: 和平时一样，我正洗澡呢，电话响了。

en: As is usual with him Mike was late for the meeting this afternoon.
zh: 迈克还是老样子，今天下午开会又迟到了。

en: As usual, Mike was late for the meeting this afternoon.
zh: 跟往常一样，迈克今天下午开会迟到了。

en: As is often the case, Mike was late for the meeting this afternoon.
zh: 迈克今天下午开会又迟到了，这在他身上是常有的事。

en: What if he fails?

en: Don't trust him, no matter what he says.
zh: 不管他说什么，都别信他。

en: Even if it takes me the whole day, I will do the typing.
zh: 就算要花上一整天，我也要把这些东西打完。

en: What would you do if you had ten thousand dollars?
zh: 如果你有一万美金，你会拿来干嘛？

en: For example, what would you do if you had ten thousand dollars?
zh: 比方说，如果你有一万美金，你会拿来干嘛？

en: For example, vervet monkeys learn to use a certain call in the presence of circling eagles, who prey on the monkeys.
zh: 比如，绿猴学会了在老鹰盘旋时发出特定的叫声，因为老鹰会捕食它们。

en: The cones of the jack pine, for example, do not readily open to release their seeds until they have been subjected to great heat.
zh: 比如，短叶松的球果除非遇到高温，否则很难裂开释放种子。

en: Young men such as you are needed for this work.
zh: 这项工作需要像你这样的年轻人。

en: For instance, in my father's business the timing of sales and purchases was very important, and he would sometimes write or say to his colleagues "There is a tide," without going into detail.
zh: 比如在我父亲的公司里，买卖的时机非常关键，他有时会不加解释地对同事说“机不可失”。

en: For example, Osaka is the sister city of San Francisco.
zh: 比如，大阪是旧金山的友好城市。

en: Birds, for instance, have a special protective device.
zh: 比如，鸟类就有一种特殊的保护机制。

en: In my social studies class, for example, there are often discussions that include the teacher as another member of the group.
zh: 比如在我的社会课上，老师经常会作为小组成员参与讨论。

en: For example, more people are choosing to live together and have children without getting married.
zh: 比如，越来越多的人选择未婚同居并生孩子。

en: For example, I am in a high-level math class that actually gives me college credits for next year.
zh: 比如，我上的一门高级数学课能抵明年大学的学分。

en: For example, do you like English?
zh: 举个例子，你喜欢英语吗？

en: For instance, gauges, such as thermometers and barometers, are instruments.
zh: 比如，像温度计和气压计这样的测量仪表都属于仪器。

en: For example, it is 7:00 a.m. in London now.
zh: 比如，现在伦敦是早上七点。

en: For example, Pepperberg would show Alex an object, such as a green wooden peg or a red paper triangle.
zh: 比如，佩珀伯格会给亚历克斯看个东西，像绿木栓或红纸三角。

en: A Frenchman, for instance, might find it hard to laugh at a Russian joke.
zh: 比如，法国人可能觉得俄罗斯笑话一点都不好笑。

en: For example, chameleons can change the color of their skin and blend with the trees and leaves around them.
zh: 比如，变色龙可以改变皮肤颜色，让自己和周围的树木叶子融为一体。

en: Take Jennifer for example.
zh: 以詹妮弗为例。

en: For example, this is a pen.
zh: 比方说，这是一支笔。

en: Like, 'Hey, I just saw a blue paper square!'
zh: 就像，“嘿，我刚看到一个蓝色的纸方块！”

en: For instance, "delight" is the opposite of "sorrow."
zh: 比如，“欣喜”是“忧伤”的反义词。

en: No matter what happens, I won't give up.
zh: 不管发生什么，我都不会放弃。

en: You shouldn't have made such a remark even if you had been angry.
zh: 就算你当时很生气，也不该说那种话。

en: Apes are intelligent.
zh: 猿类很聪明。

en: Birds of a feather flock together.
zh: 物以类聚，人以群分。

en: Apes rank above dogs in intelligence.
zh: 猿类的智商比狗高。

en: Birds of a feather will gather together.
zh: 物以类聚。

en: I was told my tear duct was blocked.
zh: 医生说我的泪管堵住了。

en: She was choked with tears and was unable to speak.
zh: 她哽咽得说不出话来。

en: Tears filled her eyes.
zh: 她眼里充满了泪水。

en: Tears fell down her cheeks.
zh: 泪水从她的脸颊流了下来。

en: Tears were rolling down her cheek.
zh: 泪水顺着她的脸颊滚落。

en: Tears were running down her cheeks.
zh: 泪水止不住地顺着她的脸颊流下来。

en: Tears trickled down her cheeks.
zh: 泪水顺着她的脸颊流了下来。

en: My eyes are watering.
zh: 我眼睛在流眼泪。

en: Tears ran down my face.
zh: 泪水顺着我的脸流了下来。

en: Tears rolled down my cheeks.
zh: 泪水从我的脸颊滚落。

en: A tear ran down her cheek.
zh: 一行清泪顺着她的脸颊流了下来。

en: My eyes are watery.
zh: 我眼里含着泪水。

en: Tears rolled down his cheeks.
zh: 泪水顺着他的脸颊流了下来。

en: Tears ran down Alice's cheeks.
zh: 泪水顺着爱丽丝的脸颊流了下来。

en: He lives in the next town.
zh: 他住在隔壁镇子上。

en: To love our neighbors is our duty.
zh: 爱护邻里是我们的责任。

en: You ought to love your neighbors.
zh: 你应该爱护你的邻居。

en: My neighbors are four sisters and a cat.
zh: 我的邻居是四姐妹和一只猫。

en: My neighbors's hen is better than mine.
zh: 邻居家的母鸡比我家的强。

zh: 邻居生病的时候，她请医生给他们送了一些医疗物资。

zh: 隔壁邻居去度假的时候，拜托我们帮他照顾一下花草。

zh: 听到隔壁传出她的声音，我挺惊讶的。

zh: 隔壁那些人半夜都不睡觉，也不知道在搞什么名堂。

zh: 我能听到隔壁有人在说话。

en: Have you got used to living in the dorm?
zh: 你习惯住校了吗？

en: Have you gotten used to living in the dorm?
zh: 你适应宿舍生活了吗？

en: The fee includes the payment for professional services needed to complete the survey.
zh: 这笔费用包含了完成调查所需的专业服务费。

en: Our dorm's heating system isn't working properly.
zh: 我们宿舍的暖气不太好使。

en: You must observe the rules of the dormitory.
zh: 你必须遵守宿舍规定。

en: A common theme underlies both perspectives.
zh: 这两种视角其实有一个共同的主题。

en: I don't like both of them.
zh: 这两个我都不喜欢。

en: I do not like both of them.
zh: 这两个我都不喜欢。

en: They are both good.
zh: 两个都挺好的。

en: Between two stools one falls to the ground.
zh: 想要两头兼顾，结果两头落空。

en: You can't have it both ways.
zh: 鱼和熊掌不可兼得。

en: The two regions differ in religion and culture.
zh: 这两个地区在宗教和文化上有所不同。

en: He scattered the coins of the money-changers and overturned their table.
zh: 他把那些换钱人的硬币撒了一地，还掀翻了他们的桌子。

en: Where can I find a place to change money?
zh: 哪儿能换钱？

en: Where is the money exchange counter?
zh: 换钱的柜台在哪儿？

en: I'd like to change some money.
zh: 我想换点钱。

en: Keep both feet firmly on the ground.
zh: 凡事要脚踏实地。

en: I got bruises on both legs.
zh: 我两条腿都青了。

en: The girl, like her parents, was very sympathetic.
zh: 那个女孩和她父母一样，非常有同情心。

en: He had his parents die in the plane accident.
zh: 他的父母在那场空难中去世了。

en: He lost his parents in a plane accident.
zh: 他在空难中失去了双亲。

en: Let me introduce my parents to you.
zh: 我给你介绍一下我爸妈。

en: Let me introduce you to my parents.
zh: 我把你介绍给我爸妈。

en: The parents couldn't make out what their daughter wanted.
zh: 父母搞不清楚女儿到底想要什么。

en: My parents enjoy skiing every winter.
zh: 我爸妈每年冬天都喜欢去滑雪。

en: They are not my real parents.
zh: 他们不是我的亲生父母。

en: My parents rely on my monthly allowance of fifty thousand yen.
zh: 我父母靠我每个月给的五万日元生活费过日子。

en: She is a trial to her parents.
zh: 她真让她父母操心。

en: His parents battled to send him to college.
zh: 他的父母辛苦挣钱供他上大学。

en: The parents succeeded in calming him down.
zh: 父母总算把他给哄住了。

en: His parents acted to calm him down.
zh: 他父母想办法让他冷静下来。

en: Both the parents are still living.
zh: 父母都还健在。

en: Both of my parents are still living.
zh: 我父母都还健在。

en: Although her parents had said no for a long time, they finally let her go to Europe alone.
zh: 虽然父母一直没同意，但最后还是让她一个人去欧洲了。

en: The parents want to give their son the best education.
zh: 父母想给儿子最好的教育。

en: The parents named their baby Akira.
zh: 父母给宝宝起名叫 Akira。

en: The parents try to amuse their baby with a toy.
zh: 父母正拿着玩具逗宝宝玩。

en: Parents are responsible for the safety of their children.
zh: 父母要对孩子的安全负责。

en: My parents were satisfied with my grades this year.
zh: 我爸妈对我今年的成绩挺满意的。

en: My parents object to my opinion.
zh: 我爸妈反对我的意见。

en: My parents told me that we should respect the elderly.
zh: 我爸妈告诉我应该尊敬老人。

en: My parents told me we should respect the old.
zh: 我爸妈告诉我应该尊敬老人。

en: My parents told me we should respect the elderly.
zh: 我爸妈告诉我应该尊敬老人。

en: My parents objected to my studying abroad.
zh: 我爸妈反对我出国留学。

en: My parents would not let me go out with boys.
zh: 我爸妈不让我跟男生出去玩。

en: My parents approved of my marrying Mary.
zh: 我爸妈同意我跟玛丽结婚。

en: My parents forbade me to see Tom again.
zh: 我爸妈不准我再见汤姆。

en: My parents didn't allow me to see Tom again.
zh: 我爸妈不让我再见汤姆。

en: My parents prohibited me from seeing Tom again.
zh: 我爸妈禁止我再见汤姆。

en: My parents expect me to enter the university.
zh: 我爸妈希望我能考上大学。

en: My parents objected to my going there alone.
zh: 我爸妈反对我一个人去那儿。

en: Parents are responsible for their children's education.
zh: 父母有责任教育孩子。

en: The parents could not help scolding their little child.
zh: 父母忍不住责备了那个小孩子。

en: My parents are old.
zh: 我爸妈年纪大了。

en: My parents came to the airport to see me off.
zh: 我爸妈去机场给我送行。

en: My parents have just arrived at the station.
zh: 我爸妈刚到车站。

en: My parents live in Kyoto.
zh: 我爸妈住在京都。

en: The parents have brought up the child well.
zh: 父母把这孩子带得很好。

en: My parents run a pension for skiers.
zh: 我爸妈开了一家专门接待滑雪者的民宿。

en: Jane's parents were pleased about her appointment as a teacher at the school.
zh: 简当上了这所学校的老师，她爸妈挺高兴的。

en: Apart from his parents, nobody would defend the suspect.
zh: 除了他父母，没谁会替那个嫌疑人说话。

en: My parents have gone to the airport to see my uncle off.
zh: 我爸妈去机场送我叔叔了。

en: Our parents live right across the street from us.
zh: 我爸妈就住在我们街对面。

en: Parents may favor the youngest child in the family.
zh: 父母可能会偏心家里最小的孩子。

en: His parents want him to go to college.
zh: 他爸妈想让他上大学。

en: My parents had me go there.
zh: 我爸妈让我去那儿。

en: My parents made me go there.
zh: 我爸妈非要我去那儿。

en: My parents let me go there.
zh: 我爸妈准我去那儿。

en: People who do not look after their parents are guilty of ingratitude.
zh: 那些不赡养父母的人真是忘恩负义。

en: After his parents' death he was brought up by his aunt.
zh: 父母去世后，是他姨妈把他拉扯大的。

en: You should obey your parents.
zh: 你应该听父母的话。

en: You should mind your parents.
zh: 你应该听你爸妈的话。

en: It is always difficult for a son to live up to the expectations of his parents.
zh: 儿子想达到父母的期望总是很难。

en: Great was the delight of his parents.
zh: 他爸妈可高兴坏了。

en: The joys of parents are secret, and so are their grief's and fears.
zh: 父母的那些开心、难过和担忧，外人是很难看出来的。

en: Either of my parents must go to the meeting.
zh: 我爸妈其中一个得去开会。

en: One of my parents has to go to the meeting.
zh: 我爸妈得去一个人开会。

en: You'll get into trouble if your parents find out.
zh: 要是让你爸妈发现了，你就麻烦了。

en: The higher the ratio of children to parents, the harder it is to bring up the children.
zh: 父母要带的孩子越多，要把他们拉扯大就越难。

en: You cannot be too good to your parents.
zh: 对父母再怎么好也不过分。

en: Please say hello to your parents.
zh: 替我向你爸妈问好。

en: Please give my regards to your parents.
zh: 请代我向你父母问候。

en: Please say hello to your parents for me.
zh: 帮我跟你爸妈带个好。

en: Be polite to your parents.
zh: 对你爸妈要有礼貌。

en: I don't want to be any more burden to my parents.
zh: 我不想再给我爸妈添负担了。

en: My parents will jump all over me.
zh: 我爸妈肯定会跟我急的。

en: Whenever Beth's parents have guests, she wants to join their adult talk.
zh: 每次贝斯的父母有客人，她总想插嘴大人们的谈话。

en: Have you acquainted your parents with your plans?
zh: 你把你那个计划告诉你爸妈了吗？

en: Both parents and teachers educate their children.
zh: 父母和老师都在教育孩子。

en: Both my parents are not alive.
zh: 我爸妈都不在了。

en: What will become of the children now that both parents are dead?
zh: 父母都去世了，这些孩子以后可怎么办啊？

en: Both of my parents aren't alive.
zh: 我父母都已经过世了。

en: Both of my parents do not play golf.
zh: 我爸妈都不打高尔夫。

en: I keep in touch with my parents by mail.
zh: 我跟我爸妈通过信件联系。

en: Not only my parents but also my sister is against my opinion.
zh: 不光我爸妈，连我姐也反对我的意见。

en: Both my parents came to see me off at the airport.
zh: 我爸妈都去机场送我了。

en: My parents are away on a trip and I'm alone in our house.
zh: 我爸妈旅游去了，家里就我一个人。

en: Because the parents divorced, the girl had little contact with the father.
zh: 因为父母离了婚，那女孩很少跟她爸联系。

en: Because her parents got divorced, the girl had little contact with her father.
zh: 因为她父母离婚了，这女孩跟她父亲基本没怎么联系过。

en: Because her parents got divorced, the girl had hardly any contact with her father.
zh: 因为她父母离了婚，那女孩几乎没跟她爸联系过。

en: Our parents took care of us and now it's our turn to take care of them.
zh: 爸妈照顾我们长大，现在轮到我们照顾他们了。

en: A child whose parents are dead is called an orphan.
zh: 父母双亡的孩子被称为孤儿。

en: After their parents died, their grandparents brought them up.
zh: 父母去世后，是爷爷奶奶把他们拉扯大的。

en: I'll look after my parents when they get old.
zh: 等我爸妈老了，我会照顾他们的。

en: I'll take care of my parents when they get old.
zh: 我会照顾老了以后的爸妈。

en: My parents didn't disagree with my plan.
zh: 我爸妈倒没反对我的计划。

en: My parents tried to convert me to their way of thinking.
zh: 我爸妈试图让我接受他们的想法。
